setTimeStamp

public void setTimeStamp(java.util.Date timeStamp)
                  throws MessageException
setTimeStamp sets the date at which this message is created. Note that the sender should not be setting this value, rather the message dispatcher should set this time prior to sending this message.
Specified by:
setTimeStamp in interface MessageIF
Parameters:
timeStamp - is a Ljava.util.Date containing the time at which this message was sent.

setUsername

public void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
setUsername sets the alias or handle of the user sending the message. Note that the user should be the one setting the alias, and the system should call this method only if a contact name or alias was not specified. The system should then set the username to be the handle of the email address.
Specified by:
setUsername in interface MessageIF
Parameters:
username - is a Ljava.lang.String containing the sender's alias or handle.
Throws:
Ljava.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported.
